intro: Fumaria gasparinii, commonly known as the Gasparinii smokeplant, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces delicate, pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters, often resembling small smoke-like clouds, hence its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. The leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
